titleInfo.title: Katsina : commodified and appropriated images of Hopi supernaturals

name.namePart: University of California, Los Angeles. Fowler Museum of Cultural History

originInfo.publisher: UCLA Fowler Museum of Cultural History

mods.note: Based on an exhibition held at the UCLA Fowler Museum of Cultural History in 2001./ Includes bibliographical references (p. 192-200).
mods.abstract: Contents: Introduction : From the sacred to the cash register -- Hopi histories -- The contemporary Katsina -- Early Euro-American ethnographers and the Hopi Tihu -- the drift from tradition -- Authentic Hopi Katsina dolls -- Intellectual and cultural property rights and appropriation of Hopi culture -- Conference statement.

titleInfo.title: Rockefeller Foundation, Projects Accession Number: 2012:073 Box: R3963 Folder 2001 cc 076 (A12)2001 CC 076 (A12) R3963
